snippet: President Obama said he would try again to close the Guantánamo prison, a goal that he all but abandoned in the face of opposition in Congress and that still faces steep challenges.
abstract: President Obama says he will recommit himself to closing Guantanamo Bay prison, goal he all but abandoned in face of Congressional opposition in his first term and faces steep challenges now; says he will try to persuade Congress to lift restrictions on transferring inmates, in move to end growing mass hunger strike at prison.
lead_paragraph: President Obama said he would try again to close the Guantánamo prison, a goal that he all but abandoned in the face of opposition in Congress and that still faces steep challenges.

headline.seo: Obama Renews Effort to Close Guantánamo
headline.main: Amid Hunger Strike, Obama Renews Push to Close Cuba Prison
headline.print_headline: Obama Renews Effort To Close Prison In Cuba

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
